title.narrative: COMMUNICATION, ADVOCACY AND PARTNERSHIP

description.narrative: UNICEF employs strategic tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy to influence policy, resources and public opinion to uphold the best interest of children with partners, donors, stakeholders, beneficiaries and general public, which contributes to Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children in development and humanitarian setting.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF employs strategic tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy to influence policy, resources and public opinion to uphold the best interest of children with partners, donors, stakeholders, beneficiaries and general public

description.narrative: UNICEF Philippines' role as leading voice, leading advocate and leading brand for children continued to grow in the first semester through setting public discourse, increasing media impact score and effectively using key messages to penetrate key platforms around key advocacy messages related to the COVID19 response and the regular outcome priorities. Building on the UNICEF Philippines Communication and Advocacy Strategy advocacy priorities are undergoing alignment with the global COVID19 advocacy framework while strongly positioning UNICEF on emerging advocacy needs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/02/2020
